user_chatgenerator.chatbot_unavailable: Sorry, the Chatbot is currently unavailable!

system_notice_testing: The system is currently in the testing phase. For official information, please contact UNIBOT2025@gmail.com
model_accuracy_notice: Note: The model may provide inaccurate answers in some cases, so please always verify the information.
question_input_hint: Enter your question – up to 3000 words
assistant_offer_help: How can I help you today?
faq_how_to_use_chatbot: How do I use the chatbot to find information?
faq_chatbot_trustworthy: Is the information from the chatbot reliable?
faq_how_chatbot_works_answer: The chatbot works by taking the user's question and applying text similarity techniques to search for relevant content in a pre-vectorized dataset stored in a vector database. It then retrieves related text chunks and uses a large language model (LLM) to generate an appropriate response.
faq_how_to_use_chatbot_answer: To use the chatbot effectively, you should ask clear and complete questions so the model can generate accurate answers. However, in some cases, the responses may be inaccurate, so it is important to verify the information or contact support if necessary.
faq_chatbot_trustworthy_answer: As the chatbot is based on probabilistic models, the information it provides may not always be accurate. Therefore, you should verify the content or contact support when needed.
faq_contact_support_answer: You can go to the Feedback/Error Reporting section or contact the Student Affairs Office of the university.

tokens_used_per_day: Number of tokens used per day
model_requests_per_day: Number of model uses per day
number_of_topics_in_system: Number of topics in the system
number_of_documents_in_system: Number of documents in the system
qa_sessions_in_month: Number of Q&A sessions in the month
info_core_params: Allows tuning the core AI model parameters to optimize performance, accuracy, and responsiveness to specific tasks. This controls the inference process, improves output quality, and ensures effective operation in different scenarios.
prompt_description: System last updated on March 9, 2025. Please provide concise and focused answers. If unsure, admit it rather than guess.
max_token_output_info:
This parameter adjusts the max number of tokens generated per response.
🔹 More tokens = longer answers → higher cost
🔹 Fewer tokens = shorter answers → less complete content
Managing this limit optimizes model performance.
threshold_info:
This is the acceptance threshold for Phobert model predictions. Predictions must be ≥ threshold to be accepted.
🔹 Result ≥ Threshold → Trustworthy prediction
🔹 Result < Threshold → Untrustworthy prediction
Managing this limit optimizes question topic identification.
use_history_label: Allow Use of History in Conversation Prediction
k_document_info:
Adjusts the number of similar documents found in the database used per response.
🔹 More documents = richer info → higher cost and hallucinations
🔹 Fewer documents = less comprehensive answers
Optimizes answer content for end users.
filter_bias_info:
Determines preference level with metadata - strict matching level.
🔹 0 = highest priority
🔹 1 = lowest priority
Optimizes model performance.
avatar_upload_warning: AI assistant avatar must be JPG, PNG, JPEG and smaller than 5MB.
feature_not_supported: This feature is not supported yet.

knowledgeBase.notePlatformDescription: A platform to organize and store information so the model can access knowledge efficiently and provide desired results.

newCollectionModal.addMetadataDescription: Define data descriptions to improve search efficiency later.

modal.confirmProcessDesc: This process will take some time. To ensure the document works efficiently, make sure your metadata and text chunks are clear and coherent.

chatbot_operation_detail: The chatbot works by taking the user's question, using techniques to find related text within a pre-vectorized dataset (text similarity), stored in a vector database. It retrieves relevant passages and then uses a large language model (LLM) to generate a response.
how_to_use_chatbot: How to use the chatbot to look up information
how_to_use_chatbot_detail: To use the chatbot most effectively, ask your questions clearly and completely so the model can provide accurate answers. However, in some cases, the responses might not be correct, so you should verify the information or contact support if necessary.
chatbot_reliability_detail: Since it is a probabilistic model, the chatbot’s information may be inaccurate in some cases. You should verify the information or contact support if necessary.
how_to_contact_support_detail: Go to the Feedback/Error Report section or contact your school's Student Affairs office.
feedback_subtitle: Your feedback is a powerful support to help us improve this product.
feedback_success: Your feedback has been recorded. Thank you!
chatbot_work_detail: The chatbot works by taking the user's question, using techniques to find text similar to the question in a pre-vectorized dataset (text similarity), and storing it in a vector database. It retrieves related text passages and then uses a large language model (LLM) to generate the answer.
is_chatbot_reliable: Is the information from the chatbot reliable?
is_chatbot_reliable_detail: Because it is a probabilistic model, the chatbot's answers may be inaccurate in some cases. You should verify the information or contact support if needed.
